content: Chapter 10. Hardware Management Console and Support Element 393 Chapter 10. Hardware Management Console and Support Element The Hardware Management Console (HMC) supports the functions and tasks that are required to manage the IBM Z servers. When tasks are performed on the HMC, the commands are sent to the Primary Support Element (SE) of the targeted system, which then issues commands to their respective central processor complex (CPC). This chapter describes the newest and most important elements for the HMC and SE. This chapter includes the following topics:  10.1, “Introduction and overview” on page 394  10.2, “HMC and SE new features and changes” on page 395  10.3, “HMC and SE connectivity” on page 412  10.4, “Remote Support Facility” on page 419  10.5, “HMC and SE capabilities” on page 420 10 Tip: The Help function is a good starting point to get more information about all of the functions that can be used by the HMC and SE. The Help feature is available by clicking Help
